ngiemboon: Pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, áa ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ pazíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò ge gÿo kẅɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Pɔ́ ge gÿo lɔg pɔ́ ndɔɔnndɔɔn é zíʼi pʉ̀a cÿɔ̌nò, e gwɔ́ gẅie ngwɔ́ é cʉ́ŋte letʉ́m pʉ̀a, é gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà moŋe Tsítsà gẅie à la gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, é gÿo púʼu, é lɔg shwoŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ge pyága wɔ́b, e ké le líi létó wɔ́.
en: There were indeed false prophets   among the people, just as there will be false teachers  # 2:1 Ac 20:29; 2Co 11:13–15; Gl 2:4; 1Tm 4:1; 2Tm 4:3 among you. They will bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought  # 2:1 1Co 6:20; 7:23 them, and will bring swift destruction on themselves.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgÿo pɔ́ menò shʉ́. Mé cʉa na pɔ́b, ńzoonte mánzsè nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: Many will follow their depraved ways, and the way of truth will be maligned because of them.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pɔ́ kwoŋ nkáb tɛʼ la, pɔ́ ge lɔgɔ shwóŋè gie pɔ́ lʉʼté lʉʼte, é lɔg lÿɔgte gẅí, é kẅé shúm sí, ńké ńgÿo púʼu pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà Ssé la láʼ ńzáʼ ntsaŋ yɔb, tà á cʉ́ʼ pɔ́ méjʉʼ ngɔ́ʼ gwé na pɔ́b.
en: They will exploit   you in their greed  # 2:3 Eph 5:3 with made-up stories. Their condemnation,  # 2:3 Mt 12:41; 23:33; Rm 3:8 pronounced long ago, is not idle, and their destruction does not sleep.

ngiemboon: Mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé la zɔɔn fʉa nò, e Ssé te wɔ́b nyé. À la tsó wɔ́b ḿmaʼa tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ á jʉʼʉ nzěm, pɔ́ ée ńgwɔ́ wó tsɛ̀ɛ menkÿo, ńne ńzẅíʼte lyɛ̌ʼ gie mé ge tsɔ́ʼte mentsaŋ.
en: For if God didn’t spare   the angels who sinned but cast them into hell  # 2:4 Gk Tartarus,# 2:4 Rv 20:2–3,10 and delivered them in chains  # 2:4 Other mss read in pits of utter darkness to be kept for judgment;  # 2:4 Mt 25:41

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ ngwòŋ we fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò gẅie pʉ̀a mesoŋ laa tsoló, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋ mefʉa e Ssé la te nyé. À la gÿo ntse fó meshÿó meshÿó ńkwɔ́ʼ, ńjÿó mengwòŋ, megàŋmbù pé fÿɛ́ɛ tsoló. Á gÿo ndàʼ Nowa, gẅie à la ne shwóŋo láʼ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, lê pʉ̀a sɔɔnmbʉ́a zɔ̌ tsẅɛ́.
en: and if he didn’t spare the ancient world, but protected Noah,   a preacher of righteousness, and seven others,  # 2:5 Lit Noah, the eighth, a preacher of righteousness,# 2:5 1Pt 3:20 when he brought the flood on the world of the ungodly;

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gíŋe ńtém ngɔ́ʼ na pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ Sondɔm mbɔɔ na pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋo Ngomɔɔ ńdɔg mmɔ̌g ḿbyága wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ pʉ̀a tepòŋ fʉ̀ʼ mmó gie á ge gÿo tóo na pɔ́b.
en: and if he reduced the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah   to ashes and condemned them to extinction,  # 2:6 Other mss omit to extinction making them an example of what is coming to the ungodly;  # 2:6 Is 1:9; Jd 15

ngiemboon: À la fó wó ńkẅile Lɔ̂d. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé Ssé, tà ńgyá tsẅé tepòŋ, lâ menò shʉ́ mie pʉ̀a mɛ̌ metÿǒsoŋ lɔ́ɔn fʉʼʉ tà sáʼa sǎʼ, é pú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ yé tɛʼ.
en: and if he rescued righteous Lot,   distressed by the depraved behavior of the immoral

ngiemboon: Yé gẅie à laa nyìŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, à lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe nùɔ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńgyá ntí gie pɔ́ lɔgɔ ńnéŋe, ńjúʼu menò mie pɔ́ gɔɔn, é gege yé gege lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm. Á nue letʉ́m sé la tyé pɔ́ na mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: (for as that righteous man lived among them day by day, his righteous soul was tormented by the lawless deeds he saw and heard  ) #— #

ngiemboon: Mé fó na mɔɔn menò, ńgyá ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kwoŋo léfó tsɛ̀ɛ ngɔ́ʼ ńkẅile pʉ̀a pie é zsé pɔ́ ndàʼ yé; é cʉ́ʼ pʉ̀a tepòŋ á nyé wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ zẅíʼte ngɔ́ʼ lyɛʼɛ́ ntsɔ̀ʼte mentsaŋ.
en: then the Lord knows how to rescue   the godly from trials and to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the day of judgment,  # 2:9 Mt 10:15; Jd 6

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ lyɛʼó, à tʉʉ lelÿò ńzáb ngɔ́ʼ twó pʉ̀a pie é néŋe ńgÿo mmó gie mbùm yɔb tsóte wɔ́b légÿo, ńnéŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn menò ncÿǒ. E Ssé gɔɔn nò pɔ́ gwág gwǎg.
en: especially those who follow the polluting desires of the flesh and despise authority.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoonte wɔ́b púʼu, tá mbà mbɔɔ mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé ké te túu lɔ̌ʼ mɛ̌ mezẅìge wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké te púte wɔ́b mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́. Tá ńké ńgẅiin metʉ̀ ńcʉa pɛ̌ pazíʼi pʉ̀a cÿɔ̌nò.
en: however, angels, who are greater in might and power, do not bring a slanderous charge against them before the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ pɔ́ pà te legye páʼ menɔ̀ɔn, é pie é la fó jʉʼó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie mé ge lʉʼ lejÿɔʼ lɔg gwoon é zẅé. Pɔ́ zoonte mmó té ne ńzsé páʼ á gwɔ́, mé gÿo ńzẅé wɔ́b páʼ menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: But these people, like irrational animals #— #creatures of instinct born to be caught and destroyed #— #slander what they do not understand, and in their destruction they too will be destroyed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg púʼu, ńkẅé ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ menò tepòŋ mie pɔ́ la fʉ̀ʼ. Anò poŋo wɔ́b tɛʼ légÿo shúm tepòŋ sie membùm mɔ́b ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, tà páʼ á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ zsǒ. Pi lâ pɔ̌ pǔ ńnéŋe ssé ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm, tá wɛ̌ légwɔ́ gwɔ́ nò shʉ́, ḿbú ḿbÿɔ́g tɛʼ, á nue á ne ḿboŋo wɔ́b páʼ pɔ́ ne fʉte gẅí.
en: They will be paid back with harm for the harm they have done. They consider it a pleasure to carouse in broad daylight. They are spots and blemishes, delighting in their deceptions   while they feast with you.

ngiemboon: Esɔ́b legye tyé pɔ́ na panzwě. Pɔ́ té kʉ́a légÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ lÿɔgte pʉ̀a pie é mwoonte mwoonte, ńnyé te kwàʼ ńzsé jʉʼ gie pɔ́ tyé wó. Letʉ́m sɔ́b ée fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńtyé pɔ́ na pì gie ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jÿó. Ndòon ee twó pɔb.
en: They have eyes full of adultery   that never stop looking for sin. They seduce unstable people and have hearts trained in greed. Children under a curse!  # 2:14 Jr 23:14; Hs 4:2; Eph 2:3; Heb 2:13

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńgwáʼa mánzsè gẅie à tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, ḿbyé, ńcʉ́ʼ ńgiŋe pɔ́ na we Mbalam, míŋ Mbozɔɔ. Mbà mé la ná nkáb mbwó yé, ńdɔg ńjúu yé páʼ à ge gÿo nò tepòŋ. Á líe nkáb é póŋo yé, á zẅíŋ.
en: They have gone astray by abandoning the straight path   and have followed the path of Balaam,  # 2:15 Nm 22:5–7; Dt 23:4; Neh 13:2; Jd 11; Rv 2:14 the son of Bosor,  # 2:15 Other mss read Beor who loved the wages of wickedness  # 2:15 Hs 9:1; Mc 1:7; Ac 1:18

ngiemboon: Táʼ, e Ssé kaga yé, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ wé na nò gie à fʉ̌a. Á júʼ nzikáasè gie ee těen shwóŋo wɔ́, e gɔɔn nò páʼ nyìŋ mesoŋ la, ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́ʼɔ mánzsè mbwó yé na yɛ̌ gʉ̀gʉ̀ nò gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgÿo.
en: but received a rebuke for his lawlessness: A speechless donkey spoke with a human voice and restrained the prophet’s madness.

ngiemboon: Pazíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ jʉʼ gie ntse kɔ́ɔn ńkẅɛɛ wó, é kěen ńjúm la, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mbʉ̀ŋ gie é kwɔ̌ʼ, afóm kaa ńdɔg ńgʉa. E Ssé léen ńnyɛte jʉʼʉ yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ssé nzěm.
en: These people are springs without water, mists driven by a storm. The gloom of darkness has been reserved for them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ mmó gie pɔ́ zíʼi pʉ̀a ńŋáʼte, tá é gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ gie é zẅɛɛ. Pɔ́ gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a ngie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie mbùm nyìŋ mesoŋ tsɔ́ɔn, tá á gwɔ́ nò shʉ́. Pɔ́ lɔg púʼu, éshwoŋte pʉ̀a pie é ka nyé ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie ée na mánzsè tepòŋ,
en: For by uttering boastful, empty words,   they seduce, with fleshly desires and debauchery, people who have barely escaped  # 2:18 Or people who are actually escaping from those who live in error.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ne shwóŋo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ge gÿo pɔ́ le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn wɔ́. Tá kwàʼ pɔ́b yɔ́b gwɔ́ menkwɔɔn mbwó shúm sie pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn, é piŋ ńne ḿbyága wɔ́b. Ammó lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńjÿó ntʉ́m nyìŋ, mbà ngàŋ cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwɔɔn mbwó yɛ̌ mmó.
en: They promise them freedom, but they themselves are slaves of corruption, since people are enslaved to whatever defeats them.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńdɔg páʼ pɔ́ zsé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ, éfó na ncÿǒ gẅie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńkẅɛ, ńgÿo ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe tsoló, ńzẅíŋ sɛ̌ shúm pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, mbà pɔ́ ge pÿɔ́g tà cʉa páʼ pɔ́ ka zɔɔn ńgwɔ́.
en: For if, having escaped the world’s impurity through the knowledge of the Lord   and Savior Jesus Christ,  # 2:20 2Pt 1:2 they are again entangled in these things and defeated, the last state is worse for them than the first.  # 2:20 Mt 12:45; Lk 11:26

ngiemboon: Mvfò kaa páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pɔ́ le zsé mánzsè ndʉŋndʉŋ wɔ́, ńcʉa páʼ pɔ́ ge zsé mbʉ̌ Ssé mie mé ka zíʼi wɔ́b e piŋ gwáʼ.
en: For it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness   than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy command  # 2:21 Rm 7:12; 1Tm 6:14 delivered  # 2:21 Jd 3 to them.  # 2:21 Ezk 18:1–32; Heb 6:4–6; 10:26–27

ngiemboon: Mbà mmó gie á gÿǒ wɔ́b, á lɔgɔ ḿbumte páʼ saglegʉa la gɔɔn ngie: «Mêngwé zeʼé ḿbiŋ ńjÿó zèʼe yé. Mé sɔgɔ kúnɔ̀ɔn tà ńgwaa tsẅé jʉʼ á gʉa ńkele tsɛ̀ɛ tetɔ̀b.»
en: It has happened to them according to the true proverb: A dog returns to its own vomit,   ,# 2:22 Pr 26:11 and, “A washed sow returns to wallowing in the mud.”
